public class MainActivity extends Activity {
    public void enableBluetooth (View view){
        BluetoothOn ble = new BluetoothOn();
        ble.initializeBlue(view);
    }
}

public class BluetoothOn{
    public TextView textView1;
    
    public void initializeBlue(View myView){
        String BleisOn = "connect me now";
        textView1 = (TextView)myView.findViewById(R.id.textView1);
        textView1.setText(BleisOn);
    }
}

To fix this, you can pass the View object as a parameter to the initializeBlue() method in the BluetoothOn class. Then, in the MainActivity, you can pass the View object to the initializeBlue() method when creating an instance of the BluetoothOn class. This way, you can access the TextView and set its text from the BluetoothOn class.
